data.name: Articuno
data.flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

attacks.name: Freeze Dry
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Aerodactyl
data.flavorText: A ferocious prehistoric Pokémon that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.

abilities.name: Prehistoric Power
abilities.text: No more Evolution cards can be played. This power stops working while Aerodactyl is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.name: Ditto
data.flavorText: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.

abilities.name: Transform
abilities.text: If Ditto is your Active Pokémon, treat it as if it were the same card as the Defending Pokémon, including type, Hit Points, Weakness, and so on, except Ditto can't evolve, always has this Pokémon Power, and you may treat any Energy attached to Ditto as Energy of any type. Ditto isn't a copy of any other Pokémon while Ditto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.name: Dragonite
data.flavorText: An extremely rarely seen marine Pokémon. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.

abilities.name: Step In
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Dragonite is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Gengar
data.flavorText: Under a full moon, this Pokémon likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.

abilities.name: Curse
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another (even if it would Knock Out the other Pokémon). This power can't be used if Gengar is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Hitmonlee
data.flavorText: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.

attacks.name: Stretch Kick
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Haunter
data.flavorText: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

abilities.name: Transparency
abilities.text: Whenever an attack does anything to Haunter, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack, including damage, done to Haunter. This power stops working while Haunter is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Hypno
data.flavorText: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.

attacks.name: Prophecy
attacks.text: Look at up to 3 cards from the top of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Kabutops
data.flavorText: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Kabutops equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Kabutops has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

data.name: Lapras
data.flavorText: A Pokémon that has been overhunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across water.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lapras but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Magneton
data.flavorText: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magneton does 100 damage to itself.

data.name: Moltres
data.flavorText: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

attacks.name: Wildfire
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Moltres when you use this attack. If you do, discard that many cards from the top of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Dive Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Muk
data.flavorText: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

abilities.name: Toxic Gas
abilities.text: Ignore all Pokémon Powers other than Toxic Gases. This power stops working while Muk is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Sludge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Raichu
data.flavorText: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.

attacks.name: Gigashock
attacks.text: Choose 3 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and this attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If your opponent has fewer than 3 Benched Pokémon, do the damage to each of them.

data.name: Zapdos
data.flavorText: A legendary thunderbird Pokémon whose anger is said to cause storms. Some say it has lived above the clouds for thousands of years.

attacks.name: Thunderstorm
attacks.text: For each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Then, Zapdos does 10 damage times the number of tails to itself.

data.name: Aerodactyl
data.flavorText: A ferocious prehistoric Pokémon that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.

abilities.name: Prehistoric Power
abilities.text: No more Evolution cards can be played. This power stops working while Aerodactyl is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.name: Articuno
data.flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

attacks.name: Freeze Dry
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Ditto
data.flavorText: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.

abilities.name: Transform
abilities.text: If Ditto is your Active Pokémon, treat it as if it were the same card as the Defending Pokémon, including type, Hit Points, Weakness, and so on, except Ditto can't evolve, always has this Pokémon Power, and you may treat any Energy attached to Ditto as Energy of any type. Ditto isn't a copy of any other Pokémon while Ditto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: An extremely rarely seen marine Pokémon. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.

abilities.name: Step In
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Dragonite is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

abilities.name: Transparency
abilities.text: Whenever an attack does anything to Haunter, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack, including damage, done to Haunter. This power stops working while Haunter is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Under a full moon, this Pokémon likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.

abilities.name: Curse
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another (even if it would Knock Out the other Pokémon). This power can't be used if Gengar is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.

attacks.name: Stretch Kick
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.

attacks.name: Prophecy
attacks.text: Look at up to 3 cards from the top of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Kabutops equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Kabutops has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that has been overhunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across water.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lapras but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magneton does 100 damage to itself.

data.name: Muk
data.flavorText: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

abilities.name: Toxic Gas
abilities.text: Ignore all Pokémon Powers other than Toxic Gases. This power stops working while Muk is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Sludge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Moltres
data.flavorText: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

attacks.name: Wildfire
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Moltres when you use this attack. If you do, discard that many cards from the top of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Dive Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Raichu
data.flavorText: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high voltage power.

attacks.name: Gigashock
attacks.text: Choose 3 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and this attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If your opponent has fewer than 3 Benched Pokémon, do that damage to each of them.

data.name: Zapdos
data.flavorText: A legendary thunderbird Pokémon whose anger is said to cause storms. Some say it has lived above the clouds for thousands of years.

attacks.name: Thunderstorm
attacks.text: For each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Then, Zapdos does 10 damage times the number of tails to itself.

data.name: Arbok
data.flavorText: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.

attacks.name: Terror Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Poison Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Cloyster
data.flavorText: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.

attacks.name: Clamp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Golduck
data.flavorText: Often seen swimming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

data.name: Golem
data.flavorText: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Golem does 100 damage to itself.

data.name: Gastly
data.flavorText: A mysterious Pokémon. Some say it is a lifeform from another dimension, while other believe it is formed from smog.

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Energy Conversion
attacks.text: Put up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand. Gastly does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Golbat
data.flavorText: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Golbat equal to the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If Golbat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

data.name: Graveler
data.flavorText: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Graveler (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

data.name: Kingler
data.flavorText: The large pincer has 10,000 horsepower of crushing power. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Kingler.

data.name: Magmar
data.flavorText: Found at the mouths of volcanoes and extremely hard to spot. There are very few instances of capturing this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Omastar
data.flavorText: A prehistoric Pokémon that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible for it to catch prey.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Omastar but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Sandslash
data.flavorText: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Slowbro
data.flavorText: The Shellder that is latched onto Slowpoke's tail is said to feed on the host's left-over scraps.

abilities.name: Strange Behavior
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to Slowbro as long as you don't Knock Out Slowbro. This power can't be used if Slowbro is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Tentacruel
data.flavorText: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Jellyfish Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Seadra
data.flavorText: Capable of swimming backward by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Seadra but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Seadra.

data.name: Weezing
data.flavorText: Where two kinds of poison gases meet, two Koffings can fuse into a Weezing over many years.

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Weezing does 60 damage to itself.

data.name: Ekans
data.flavorText: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds such as Pidgey and Spearow whole.

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Grimer
data.flavorText: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

attacks.name: Nasty Goo
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: All damage done by attacks to Grimer during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Horsea
data.flavorText: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.name: Kabuto
data.flavorText: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.

abilities.name: Kabuto Armor
abilities.text: Whenever an attack (even your own) does damage to Kabuto (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does half the damage to Kabuto (rounded down to the nearest 10). (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Kabuto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.name: Geodude
data.flavorText: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

attacks.name: Stone Barrage
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Krabby
data.flavorText: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon named Krabby and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench if full.)

data.name: Omanyte
data.flavorText: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.

abilities.name: Clairvoyance
abilities.text: Your opponent plays with his or her hand face up. This power stops working while Omanyte is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Omanyte but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

data.name: Slowpoke
data.flavorText: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

attacks.name: Spacing Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove a damage counter from Slowpoke. This attack can't be used if Slowpoke has no damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Scavenge
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Slowpoke in order to use this attack. Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Tentacool
data.flavorText: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.

abilities.name: Cowardice
abilities.text: At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may return Tentacool to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to Tentacool.) This power can't be used the turn you put Tentacool into play or if Tentacool is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.name: Psyduck
data.flavorText: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily Pokémon will use psychokinetic powers.

attacks.name: Headache
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play Trainer cards during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Shellder
data.flavorText: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Hide in Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Shellder during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

data.name: Zubat
data.flavorText: Forms colonies in perpetually dark places. Uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Zubat equal to the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If Zubat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

data.name: Mr. Fuji
rules: Choose a Pokémon on your Bench. Shuffle it and any cards attached to it into your deck.

data.name: Mysterious Fossil
rules: Play Mysterious Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Mysterious Fossil counts as a Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Mysterious Fossil has no attacks, can't retreat, and can't be Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. If Mysterious Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Mysterious Fossil from play.

data.name: Energy Search
rules: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Gambler
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Flip a coin. If heads, draw 8 cards. If tails, draw 1 card.

data.name: Recycle
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, put a card in your discard pile on top of your deck.
